query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
1 Affetto al suo piacer, quel contemplante 2 libero officio di dottore assunse, 3 e cominciò queste parole sante:
4 «La piaga che Maria richiuse e unse, 5 quella ch’è tanto bella da’ suoi piedi 6 è colei che l’aperse e che la punse.
query.result:
**English:**
1 Moved by his pleasure, that contemplative one 2 assumed the free office of a teacher, 3 and began these holy words:
4 "The wound that Mary closed and anointed, 5 that which is so beautiful at her feet, 6 is she who opened it and who pierced it.
**Old English:**
1 Astyred ðurh his willan, se willa gleawra 2 freolic ðegnung ðæs lareowes onfeng, 3 and ðas word onsægde:
4 "Ðæt wund ðe Maria wunode and smyrede, 5 ðæt ðe is swiðe fæger æt ðinum fotum, 6 ðæt is ðæt ðe hit ontynde and ðe hit ðurhwundode.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
7 Ne l’ordine che fanno i terzi sedi, 8 siede Rachel di sotto da costei 9 con Bëatrice, sì come tu vedi.
query.result:
**English:**
7 In the order that the third seats make, 8 Rachel sits below her 9 with Beatrice, as you see.
**Old English:**
7 On ðære endebyrd ðe ða ðriddan setl wyrceð, 8 sitteð Rahel binnan ðære 9 mid Bearhtrice, swa ðu gesihst.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
10 Sarra e Rebecca, Iudìt e colei 11 che fu bisava al cantor che per doglia 12 del fallo disse ‘Miserere mei’,
13 puoi tu veder così di soglia in soglia 14 giù digradar, com’ io ch’a proprio nome 15 vo per la rosa giù di foglia in foglia.
query.result:
**English:**
10 Sarah and Rebecca, Judith, and she 11 who was ancestress to the singer who, in sorrow 12 for his sin, said ‘Have mercy on me’,
13 you can see thus descend from threshold to threshold 14 down below, as I, who by my own name 15 go down through the rose from petal to petal.
**Old English:**
10 Sara and Rebeccan, Iudith and heo 11 ðe wæs bisen ðam sangere ðe for sorgum 12 his synna cwæð ‘Miserere mei’,
13 ðu miht ðus geseon swa of ðrepum on ðrepum 14 nyðer stigan, swa ic ðe ðurh ðone naman minum 15 fare ðurh ðone rosan of leaf to leaf.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
28 E come quinci il glorïoso scanno 29 de la donna del cielo e li altri scanni 30 di sotto lui cotanta cerna fanno,
31 così di contra quel del gran Giovanni, 32 che sempre santo ’l diserto e ’l martiro 33 sofferse, e poi l’inferno da due anni;
34 e sotto lui così cerner sortiro 35 Francesco, Benedetto e Augustino 36 e altri fin qua giù di giro in giro.
query.result:
**English:**
28 And as here the glorious throne 29 of the lady of heaven and the other thrones 30 below it make such a great circle,
31 so opposite that of the great John, 32 who always holy suffered the desert and martyrdom 33 and then hell for two years;
34 and below him thus obtained their places 35 Francis, Benedict, and Augustine 36 and others down here in circle after circle.
**Old English:**
28 And swa her ðæt wuldorfulle setl 29 ðære heofona cwene and ða oðre setl 30 ðe be neoðan him swa micelne hring wyrcað,
31 swa on ðære healfe ðæs miclan Iohannes, 32 ðe symle halig ðone westen and ðone martyrdom 33 ðrowade, and siððan helle twa gear;
34 and be neoðan him swa hlotu gecuron 35 Franciscus, Benedictus and Augustinus 36 and oðre oð ðis niðor ymb and ymb.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
37 Or mira l’alto proveder divino: 38 ché l’uno e l’altro aspetto de la fede 39 igualmente empierà questo giardino.
query.result:
**English:**
37 Now behold the lofty divine providence: 38 that both the one and the other aspect of the faith 39 will equally fill this garden.
**Old English:**
37 Nu gehyr ðu ðæs hehstan dryhtnes mihte: 38 ðæt ægðer ge ðis ge ðæt ðære geleafan 39 efenlice ðisne wong gefylleð.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
40 E sappi che dal grado in giù che fiede 41 a mezzo il tratto le due discrezioni, 42 per nullo proprio merito si siede,
43 ma per l’altrui, con certe condizioni: 44 ché tutti questi son spiriti ascolti 45 prima ch’avesser vere elezïoni.
query.result:
**English:**
40 And know that from the grade below which strikes 41 halfway along the path the two discretions, 42 no one sits there through his own merit,
43 but through another’s, with certain conditions: 44 for all these spirits are spirits who were heard 45 before they had true choices.
**Old English:**
40 And wíte ðæt fram ðæm hæðe ofan nið 41 oð midne weg ða twegen gesceádas, 42 ðurh nán agen geearnung ne sítt man,
43 ac ðurh ðæs óðres, mid geþingum sumum: 44 forðæm ðe ealle ðás synd gastas gehyrde 45 ær ðæm ðe híe hæfdon sóðe gecorenysse.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
46 Ben te ne puoi accorger per li volti 47 e anche per le voci püerili, 48 se tu li guardi bene e se li ascolti.
query.result:
**English:**
46 You can easily perceive it from their faces, 47 and also from their childish voices, 48 if you look at them carefully and listen to them.
**Old English:**
46 Þu miht ðæt liðelice oncnawan be ðæra nebba, 47 and eac be ðæra cildra stefna, 48 gif ðu hi wel behealde and hi gehyre.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
49 Or dubbi tu e dubitando sili; 50 ma io discioglierò ’l forte legame 51 in che ti stringon li pensier sottili.
query.result:
**English:**
49 Or do you doubt and tarry? 50 But I will loosen the strong bond 51 in which your subtle thoughts hold you fast.
**Old English:**
49 Oððe tweost ðu and tweogende wunige; 50 ac ic ðone heardan bend gehealde, 51 on ðam ðe ðine ðohtas ðe fæste bindað.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
52 Dentro a l’ampiezza di questo reame 53 casüal punto non puote aver sito, 54 se non come tristizia o sete o fame:
55 ché per etterna legge è stabilito 56 quantunque vedi, sì che giustamente 57 ci si risponde da l’anello al dito;
58 e però questa festinata gente 59 a vera vita non è sine causa 60 intra sé qui più e meno eccellente.
query.result:
**English:**
52 Within the amplitude of this realm 53 a random point cannot have a place, 54 except as sadness or thirst or hunger:
55 because by eternal law it is established 56 whatever you see, so that justly 57 one responds to the other, as the ring to the finger;
58 and therefore this hasty multitude 59 is not without cause 60 among themselves here more and less excellent.
**Old English:**
52 Binnon ðæs rīces rīmnesse 53 ne mæg nænig casuel punt stede habban, 54 būton swa swa unrōt oððe ðurst oððe hungor:
55 forðæm ðe ðurh ēce æ ðæs is gestaðelod 56 eall ðæt ðu gesihst, swa ðæt gerīsenlīce 57 man andwyrdeð ðurh ðone hring ðæm fingre;
58 and forðæm ðeos gefylsta menigu 59 nis būton intingan tō sōðre līfe 60 betwux him sylf hēr mā and læsse selost.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
61 Lo rege per cui questo regno pausa 62 in tanto amore e in tanto diletto, 63 che nulla volontà è di più ausa,
64 le menti tutte nel suo lieto aspetto 65 creando, a suo piacer di grazia dota 66 diversamente; e qui basti l’effetto.
query.result:
**English:**
61 The king for whom this kingdom is at peace 62 in such love and in such delight, 63 that no will is more daring,
64 creates all minds in his joyful aspect, 65 endowing them with grace according to his pleasure, 66 in different ways; and here let the effect suffice.
**Old English:**
61 Se cyning ðurh ðone ðis rice restað 62 on ðam miclan lufe and ðam miclan wynne, 63 ðæt nan will næs ðæs mara dyrstig,
64 ða mod ealle on his ðam liðan hiwe 65 scyppende, æfter his willan wuldre gegearwoð 66 mislice; and her ðæt geweorc genihtsum sie.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
67 E ciò espresso e chiaro vi si nota 68 ne la Scrittura santa in quei gemelli 69 che ne la madre ebber l’ira commota.
query.result:
**English:**
67 And this is noted for you, expressed and clear, 68 in the holy Scripture, in those twins 69 who in their mother stirred up wrath.
**Old English:**
67 And ðis is eow to secganne gesyne 68 on ðære halgan gewrite on ðam gebroðrum ðam twæm 69 ðe on ðære meder ongunnon morðre fremman.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
70 Però, secondo il color d’i capelli, 71 di cotal grazia l’altissimo lume 72 degnamente convien che s’incappelli.
query.result:
**English:**
70 Therefore, according to the color of her hair, 71 with such grace the highest light 72 is fittingly crowned.
**Old English:**
70 Forðæm, æfter ðæs hæres hiwum, 71 ðære fægeran gife ðæs hehstan leohtes 72 gedefelice gedafenað ðæt hit gewæfed sie.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
73 Dunque, sanza mercé di lor costume, 74 locati son per gradi differenti, 75 sol differendo nel primiero acume.
query.result:
**English:**
73 Therefore, without the mercy of their custom, 74 they are placed in different grades, 75 differing only in their initial sharpness.
**Old English:**
73 Forðæm, butan miltse heora ðeawes, 74 sindon gesette be gemetum mislicum, 75 ana ðæm frumsceaftum ana ðæm ærestan ecge.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
85 Riguarda omai ne la faccia che a Cristo 86 più si somiglia, ché la sua chiarezza 87 sola ti può disporre a veder Cristo».
query.result:
**English:**
85 Look now upon the face that most resembles Christ, 86 for its brightness alone can prepare you to see Christ.
**Old English:**
85 Loca nu on ðæt neb ðe Criste 86 gelicost is, forðan ðe his beorhtnes ana 87 mæg ðe gearcian ðæt ðu Criste geseo.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
88 Io vidi sopra lei tanta allegrezza 89 piover, portata ne le menti sante 90 create a trasvolar per quella altezza,
91 che quantunque io avea visto davante, 92 di tanta ammirazion non mi sospese, 93 né mi mostrò di Dio tanto sembiante;
94 e quello amor che primo lì discese, 95 cantando ‘Ave, Maria, gratïa plena’, 96 dinanzi a lei le sue ali distese.
query.result:
**English:**
88 I saw so much joy raining down upon her, 89 carried by the holy minds 90 created to fly through that height,
91 that although I had seen so much before, 92 none had suspended me in such wonder, 93 nor shown me so much of God's countenance;
94 and that love which first descended there, 95 singing 'Ave, Maria, gratia plena', 96 spread its wings before her.
**Old English:**
88 Ic geseah ðær ofer hyre swa micel blisse 89 regnian, geboren on ða halgan sawla 90 gesceapene to ðære heanisse fleogan,
91 ðæt ðeah ðe ic ær gesawe swa fela, 92 næfre ic ðurh ða wundrunge ne ðohte, 93 ne me ðæs Godes ansyn swa ne æteowde;
94 and ðæt fyrst ðær nyðer astah, 95 singende 'Ave, Maria, gratia plena', 96 hyre beforan ða fyðru onbryrde.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
97 Rispuose a la divina cantilena 98 da tutte parti la beata corte, 99 sì ch’ogne vista sen fé più serena.
query.result:
**English:**
97 The blessed court responded to the divine song 98 from every side, 99 so that every sight became more serene.
**Old English:**
97 Andswarode ðære godcundan stefne 98 of eallum healfum ða halgan weras, 99 swa ðæt æghwylc gesyhð wæs ða sylfre.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
100 «O santo padre, che per me comporte 101 l’esser qua giù, lasciando il dolce loco 102 nel qual tu siedi per etterna sorte,
103 qual è quell’ angel che con tanto gioco 104 guarda ne li occhi la nostra regina, 105 innamorato sì che par di foco?».
query.result:
**English:**
100 "O holy father, who for my sake endure 101 being down here, leaving the sweet place 102 in which you sit by eternal lot,
103 who is that angel who with such joy 104 looks into the eyes of our queen, 105 so enamored that he seems to be on fire?"
**Old English:**
100 "Eala, halige fæder, ðe ðurh me geðoloðe 101 ðæt ðu her niðer come, forlætende ðone swetan stede 102 ðær ðu on sitst ðurh ece gesceaft,
103 hwæt is se engel þe mid swilcum gamenum 104 lociað on ða eagan urere cwene, 105 swilce he ðurh lufe sy on fyre?"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
106 Così ricorsi ancora a la dottrina 107 di colui ch’abbelliva di Maria, 108 come del sole stella mattutina.
query.result:
**English:**
106 Thus I had recourse again to the teaching 107 of him who beautified Mary, 108 as the morning star [is beautified] by the sun.
**Old English:**
106 Þus ic eft ongann ðurh ðære lare 107 ðæs ðe Marian mærðum fremede, 108 swa ðæs sunnan steorra on morgentid.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
109 Ed elli a me: «Baldezza e leggiadria 110 quant’ esser puote in angelo e in alma, 111 tutta è in lui; e sì volem che sia,
112 perch’ elli è quelli che portò la palma 113 giuso a Maria, quando ’l Figliuol di Dio 114 carcar si volse de la nostra salma.
query.result:
**English:**
109 And he said to me: "Boldness and grace, 110 as much as can be in angel and in soul, 111 are all in him; and we will that it be so,
112 because he is the one who bore the palm 113 down to Mary, when the Son of God 114 wished to burden himself with our human form.
**Old English:**
109 And he said to me: "Boldness and grace, 110 as much as can be in angel and in soul, 111 are all in him; and we will that it be so,
112 because he is the one who bore the palm 113 down to Mary, when the Son of God 114 wished to burden himself with our human form.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
115 Ma vieni omai con li occhi sì com’ io 116 andrò parlando, e nota i gran patrici 117 di questo imperio giustissimo e pio.
query.result:
**English:**
115 But now come with your eyes as I 116 go speaking, and note the great patricians 117 of this most just and pious empire.
**Old English:**
115 Ac nu cuma nu mid ðinum eagum swa swa ic 116 wille sprecende, and gecneow ða miclan ealdras 117 ðisses swiðe rihtwisan and arfæstan anwealdes.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
118 Quei due che seggon là sù più felici 119 per esser propinquissimi ad Agusta, 120 son d’esta rosa quasi due radici:
121 colui che da sinistra le s’aggiusta 122 è il padre per lo cui ardito gusto 123 l’umana specie tanto amaro gusta;
124 dal destro vedi quel padre vetusto 125 di Santa Chiesa a cui Cristo le chiavi 126 raccomandò di questo fior venusto.
query.result:
**English:**
118 Those two who are said to be happier there 119 for being closest to Augusta, 120 are like two roots of this rose:
121 the one who is placed on its left 122 is the father through whose bold taste 123 the human race tastes so much bitterness;
124 on the right you see that ancient father 125 of Holy Church to whom Christ entrusted the keys 126 of this beautiful flower.
**Old English:**
118 Þa twegen þe secgað þær sylfum sælbran 119 forðæm þe hi syndon Agistan gehende, 120 syndon of þysse rose swylce twegen wyrttruman:
121 se þe on þa wynstran hyre gewended is 122 ys se fæder ðurh ðæs geleafan geornfulnysse 123 mancyn swa bysmorlice bysig byð;
124 on þa swyðran þu gesyhst þone ealdan fæder 125 haligre cyrcan þe Crist þa cægan bebeád 126 þysses fægeran blostman.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
127 E quei che vide tutti i tempi gravi, 128 pria che morisse, de la bella sposa 129 che s’acquistò con la lancia e coi clavi,
130 siede lungh’ esso, e lungo l’altro posa 131 quel duca sotto cui visse di manna 132 la gente ingrata, mobile e retrosa.
query.result:
**English:**
127 And he who saw all the difficult times, 128 before he died, of the beautiful bride 129 that he acquired with the lance and the nails,
130 sits beside him, and beside the other rests 131 that leader under whom the ungrateful, fickle, and stubborn 132 people lived on manna.
**Old English:**
127 And se ðe ealle ða earfoðu geseah, 128 ær his endedæg, ðære fægran bryde 129 ðe he mid spere and mid nægle gewann,
130 sitteð him be healfe, and be oðrum healfe 131 se heretoga ðe ða folc mid heofonlicum mete 132 lædde, ða unþancan, ða wancolmodan, ða widerweardan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
145 Veramente, ne forse tu t’arretri 146 movendo l’ali tue, credendo oltrarti, 147 orando grazia conven che s’impetri
148 grazia da quella che puote aiutarti; 149 e tu mi seguirai con l’affezione, 150 sì che dal dicer mio lo cor non parti».
query.result:
**English:**
145 Truly, you might not turn back 146 moving your wings, believing to surpass them, 147 praying for grace that must be implored.
148 Grace from her who can help you; 149 and you will follow me with affection, 150 so that your heart does not depart from my words."
**Old English:**
145 Soðlice, ðu ne miht ðe eft gecyrran 146 ðinum fiðrum hweorðende, wēnende ðe ofer ða, 147 biddendum ðearfe is ðæt ðu miltse biddende sie.
148 Milts fram ðære ðe ðe helpan mæg; 149 and ðu me folgað mid lufan, 150 swa ðæt ðin heorte fram minum wordum ne awende."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
151 E cominciò questa santa orazione:
query.result:
**English:**
151 And he began this holy prayer:
**Old English:**
151 And ða ongan ðeos halige gebed:
